channel.title: Compiling with 2 people
channel.description: So me and a mate started a new server (with him being Hoster and me being Coder)... So he has sent me proper files and all that but i keep getting this error when i try and compile, it works fine when he compiles but for me it keeps saying Access is Denied. Before that it pops up this message..[b]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe is not a Valid Win32 application.[/b] And thats basically my problem, now im unsure if this topic has been reviewed but if ANYONE can help me out that'd be greatful (Im a new coder) :)

item.title: Compiling with 2 people
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Pacific_Coder_NEW:

Just everything he said, if anyone has TV(TeamViewer) and wouldn’t mind taking a look, i’d gladly appreciate just shoot me an Email (or private message) and ill get back to ya.

I can’t T.V atm, but ill help you step by step,
First step, do you have JDK installed?

item.title: Compiling with 2 people
item.dc:creator: @Smyril Smyril
item.description:
@Smyril wrote:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/java-se-jdk-7-download-432154.html

download java jdk & se 1.7 from that link, also you should add environmental variables too.

win 7 & vista goto start > right click on computer > properties > advanced system settings > on advanced tab > environmental variables

if CLASSPATH isn’t in the list, press new on system variables:

variable name: CLASSPATH
variable value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin;

however if the classpath exists, and you have a previous version in there, then modify it, and if you have classpath and not have then just add semi-colon at the end (if it isn’t already) and then paste variable value after the semi-colon(;).

now find path under system variables add “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin;” without the quotation marks (") at the end, make sure theres a semi-colon in the end of the variable before you paste it in.

then modify your compiler to do javac.exe *.java instead of writing the path C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe *.java

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling with 2 people
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

coolguy12123:

Quick question; Is it even possible to compile with 2 people???

You don’t get what he is saying, all it is, is that he and his friend both have the server on their computer, but he cannot compile and his friend can.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling with 2 people
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

Why don’t you just edit the files then send them back to him, then have him compile and run the server.

Since he’s the host that seems to make sense to me.

And you probably just don’t have JDK installed.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ethaaann wrote:

go to C:drive>program files>java>bin then click folder link bar and copy paste into what matches when you right click complier and run.
